sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a base that measures 6 meters by 8 meters and a height of 10 meters. Find the volume of the pyramid.
message_2:
To find the volume of a rectangular pyramid, you can use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height

The base area of the pyramid can be found by multiplying the length and width of the base:

Base Area = Length * Width
Base Area = 6 meters * 8 meters
Base Area = 48 square meters

Now, you can find the volume of the pyramid:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height
Volume = (1/3) * 48 square meters * 10 meters
Volume = (1/3) * 480 cubic meters
Volume = 160 cubic meters

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is 160 cubic meters.
